bibl.title: Wiley v. Keokuk. Petition in Error
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Albert Wiley Plaintiff
Keokuk, Chief of the Sce & Top Indians Defendant }
In the Supreme Court of the State of Kansas Petition in Error

The said plaintiff complains of said defendant for that the said defendant at the special April term of the district Court Ad, 1869, for said County of Days in the State of Kansas, recovered a judgm by the consideration of said court again the said plaintiff in a certain action pending in said court wherein the said Keokuk chief of the Sac Fiax Indians, plaintiff and the said Albert Wiley. Charles Leithix. Thomas Murphy, Thomas do William P. Monlgiong, were defendants a copy of the case made artificial is attached worked. A, and the said Albert Wiley evers that there is error in the record and proceedings, in this to arts,
1st That the said court erred in overruling the plaintiff. Challenge for, canny, of Walter a juror
2d That the said Court used in the instruction given to the jury, on the tried of said action.
3d That the said court errd in refusing to give the instructions which the said Albert Wiley prayed the Court to give the jury.
4h That the verdict & judgement of said court of the jury is not sustaind by the evidence and is contrary to law.
5th That the demifys grin of the jury and the judgement ajoint in Albert Wiley and cassive.
6th That the judgement was given for the said Keokuk when it ought to have been given for the said Albert Wiley according to law
